title: Manipulate Arrays With shift Method
content: pop() always removes the last element of an array. What if you want to remove the first?
That's where .shift() comes in. It works just like .pop(), except it removes the first element instead of the last.
removedFromOurArray shoud have a value of the string Stimpson, and ourArray would have ['J',['cat']]

exercises.instruction: Use the .shift() function to remove the first item from myArray and assign the 'shifted off' value to a new variable, removedFromMyArray
